name: St. Andrew Bobola

locations.description: Jesuit priest and martyr in Poland

summary: Andrew Bobola was a Polish Jesuit priest and missionary who was martyred during the Khmelnytsky Uprising. Known as the 'Apostle of Polesia,' he worked to convert Orthodox Christians to Catholicism. He was brutally tortured and killed by Cossacks for his faith and missionary work. He is a patron saint of Poland.
